question.text: Diabetes is one of the most common lifestyle disorders in India, which is successfully treated with insulin therapy which reduces the blood glucose level. Which of the following mechanisms correctly shows the action of insulin in lowering blood glucose level?

options.text: It stimulates the breakdown of glycogen.
It stimulates the process of gluconeogenesis.
It acts on adipocytes and hepatocytes and increase cellular glucose uptake and utilization.
It reduces glucose uptake and utilization.

solution.text: Insulin and Glucagon are two main hormones that bring about glucose metabolism in humans. Glucagon is secreted by alpha cells of islets of langerhans that are small clusters of endocrine cells in pancreas and Insulin is released by beta cells of pancreas. Glucagon brings about breakdown of glycogen into glucose and thus increases the level of glucose in blood. Insulin further carries this glucose to different cells and thus reduces blood glucose level. After cellular uptake too if the glucose levels are high in the blood insulin causes mobilization of glucose from blood into hepatocytes and adipocytes where it gets converted into glycogen which is the reserve form.
